results.title: Encouraging Employee Ownership Act
results.committees: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee
results.latest_major_action: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 15.
results.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.) Encouraging Employee Ownership Act  (Sec. 2) This bill  requires the Securities and Exchange Commission to increase, from $5 million to $10 million, the 12-month sales threshold beyond which an issuer is required to provide investors with additional disclosures related to compensatory benefit plans.
results.summary_short: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.) Encouraging Employee Ownership Act  (Sec. 2) This bill  requires the Securities and Exchange Commission to increase, from $5 million to $10 million, the 12-month sales threshold beyond which an issuer is required to provide investors with additional disclosures related to compensatory benefit plans.

actions.description: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 15.
Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Reported by Senator Crapo without amendment. Without written report.
Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.
